website_summaries.verdict: Delivers a terrific blend of affordability, convenience, and quality.
pros: Wide angled head makes it simple to remove snow
24" polyethylene blade is strong and durable
cons: Designed for moderate roof snow removal only

customer_reviews.title: This was my first use and it was worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: I used the snow rake after this weekend's (Dec. 10, 2018) snow storm left us with 15" on the ground and on my roof. The rod sections coupled together nicely and the whole unit held together without any flaws. I wish it came with a couple more straight sections as I was only able to pull down about 5-6 ft. of snow from the roof while standing on the ground. Once I use it a few more times I will try to update this review but so far I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KC8RXQ

customer_reviews.title: Long enough and sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Great roof rake. A lot of people have commented it doesn't feel strong enough, but if it was stronger I feel it would be too heavy. It definitely does the job. Only had it since last year so not sure how long it will last, but so far so good. It doesn't do ice, just snow, so be realistic about your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Roxief

customer_reviews.title: Great product, does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one just for the extra poles. It's the exact one I bought about 8 years ago, and the poles fit together perfectly. It is very heavy and floppy with six poles on it though, be warned. It beats dragging the ladder out in the snow just to be able to reach the second-story roof. Probably a lot safer for me too.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsyguy

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have use this device for two winters now, including the heaviest snowfall I've experienced in this home. (Measurable in feet.) It seemed a little vulnerable to breakage, but it's held up quite well. It's light enough to maneuver with little problem. I bought a handle extension because of the "stretch" I needed to reach the peak. As others have mentioned, the wisdom of a second extension is questionable. With just one extension, you're pretty much on the verge of becoming a highly skilled and very buff fly rod fisherman by spring.
customer_reviews.author: Grounpouner

customer_reviews.title: Works well but extensions could be easier to attach and detach
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I found the sections difficult to connect and disconnect with the button and hole fasteners when the rake is very cold. Since this is when I'm likely to use it that's not a good thing. The rake itself works fine. With all 3 sections in place it is rather unwieldy and takes some height and strength to use. As a 115 pound woman it works for me as is without extensions attached. Wish the extensions were shorter, i.e. 4 instead of 3 to achieve the same reach. The most beneficial thing about the rake is that it can be used from the ground around the first floor eaves.
customer_reviews.author: Dinah

customer_reviews.title: Broke after using it 2nd time
customer_reviews.text: I just want to make this clear. I followed instruction, even did research on how to use this. The first time I used it was great. The second time it broke at the base (scraper part). there wasn't more than 6 inches of snow on my roof. Not very happy....
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell C.

customer_reviews.title: A good tool, but the picture was a little deceiving
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool after my dissatisfaction with an inferior model purchased locally. I was looking for a taller blade. That being said, the design feature which is important is that the stabilizing brackets are at the top of the blade versus the bottom. This allows the snow to fall freely from the blade when pulled over the edge of the roof instead of the snow being trapped by the stabilizing blades when on the bottom and making the rake heavy and the snow difficult to dislodge. Overall, a productive and useful tool. A taller blade would make it more so.
customer_reviews.author: Cymbeline

customer_reviews.title: Assemblage :-(
customer_reviews.text: I'm just tired of companies that provide sparse and impossible to understand assemblage instructions, as is the case here. You would think a roof rake would fall into the easy-to-assemble category, but no... I wasted almost an hour and finally just put duct tape on areas that wouldn't go through. Just charge me a reasonable $10-$15 so I can get this fully or mostly assembled and not have to waste my time, or create a video with a step by step tutorial that makes everything clear. Even so, there was one bolt that would *just not go in*. So much time is wasted with assemblage of products, and customers really need to hold these companies accountable.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My first review didnt pass the review process? Okay I’ll try again. I was shipped a product that did not have any of the mounting hardware. I was forced to buy my own parts to assemble. Oh and now I tried to use the one that came with all the parts and the one I had to build. Snow was crusty and the rake couldn’t even scratch the surface. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that the poles have the non-slip surface and aren't just aluminum; no more grey aluminum coloring on my gloves... My 20 year old rake finally broke so I bought this one. The only thing I think could be better is the side supports; my old rake had galvanized steel round stock supports and these are aluminum flat stock which bend easy; they don't bend bad but they do bend so I am not sure long term how they will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Georgia so we don't get a lot of snow. I bought this to rake several feet of wet pine straw and dirt off of the roof of a shed. It held up very well and was surprisingly very sturdy yet light. If it can pull down several feet of wet compacted pine straw then it will probably do very well with snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I chose this older style roof rake then that with wheels as they have many issues, this one has been a gem, we live in Central Wisconsin and have a ton of snow these past two years, eight inches a drop lately. This rake did the job, min you I had three ft of snow and ice on the roof, Its still in one piece, no issues here, but make sure you wear gloves as the pole part get super cold.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlykay

customer_reviews.title: Well designed snow rake
customer_reviews.text: I found this roof rake easy to assemble and the areas that join seem to have strong support. The rake is relatively light using two sections but is a little heavy with all three sections attached. The joining buttons work smoothly unlike my previous snow rake.
customer_reviews.author: Carver

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction! Everything fits well.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and am very pleased. It was very easy to put together. Instructions are good and easy to follow. All parts arrived in good condition. The thing I like best is the very sturdy construction of the rake itself and the handles. The rake is very thick plastic that should last a lifetime. The handles are aluminum and coated with a rough paint that will make gripping the handles essier and also make the connections tighter. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: L. King

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, works great
customer_reviews.text: First time using it on about six inches of wet snow. took about 3-4 ft. pull each time worked great. very light weight, easily assembled. Had to purchase my own cap for the handle end. Went to Home depot and bought a 1" leg bottom.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rake to get the snow off of our solar panels. It's great!. I'm a 69 year old woman and wondered if I would be strong enough to use it fully extended on my own, so I asked my husband to stand by while I gave it a try. I had no difficulty at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: 2 years, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my parents & it helped out a lot. No issues after 2 years of use. Would definitely recommend & am thinking about buying one for myself now that I am in a place that needs a roof rake.
customer_reviews.author: jmcgouldrick

customer_reviews.title: It does the job well
customer_reviews.text: What a thrill to buy something manufactured in North America. Easy to assemble with quality parts. You need a 7/16 socket and/or an open end wrench. Total assembly time about ten minutes. Now for does it work, yes it does. We just got 14 inches of snow and the rake works great. Take small sections and work your way up the roof. No more ice dams for me!
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: Roof rake
customer_reviews.text: The pros: nice length and can extend easily to hit whole roof. Easy to out together. The cons: not as sturdy as I would like. Because the poles are hallow and the shovel blade is plastic there isnt much weight to the rake. This makes it difficult to cut down through the snow. It does its job. It is.just not as good as other rakes that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lasek

customer_reviews.title: Not quite long enough to reach all my panels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rake to remove snow from my solar panels. Upon receiving the box, it appeared to have been previously opened, and was missing a few pieces which made it impossible to assemble. Fortunately, Amazon sent a replacement. After assembling the replacement and testing, it turns out the rake doesn't fully reach the top row of panels. I will try again with a ladder the next time we get snow.
customer_reviews.author: abby

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to use with a very durable design
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use with a very durable design. It takes some getting used to because you have to really balance when you have all 3 extensions connected. Great quality! when you take it apart, it fits easy in my truck to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Engleheart

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, light roof rake
customer_reviews.text: Living in the Boston area we have been desperate for a roof rake the past few winters, and have finally found a superior rake in this Garant Yukon 24-inch rake. We have been borrowing our neighbors' rakes (because they have been all sold out in our area for a while), and this rake performed much better than theirs in comparison. It is lightweight, and easy to handle - it goes where you place it without wobbling all over the place. The blade does an excellent job of pulling the snow. I would highly recommend this rake compared to others. UPDATE 1/26/14: This rake is still going strong through several winter storms!
customer_reviews.author: J. Remsen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy Used a good deal during winter storm Harper.
customer_reviews.text: Handles/ poles have a coating. Making them easy to grasp when wet. Unlike my old style poles plus gloves stay clean. Used a great deal during winter storm Harper. Takes a few minutes to assemble with all the hardware accounted for. Buy with confidence. I ordered two units and happy to have a few extra length of poles.
customer_reviews.author: Bluestone19

customer_reviews.title: Might be good?
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be a good product. They assembly was quick and the poles are decent. The snow blade itself is smaller than expected. Haven’t gotten any snow yet to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to put pipes on and off. Have done several roofs with it. We got alot of snow in Minnesota this year.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This works great for removing snow a high On the rooftop
customer_reviews.author: Orla

customer_reviews.title: Good product, light, pro-tip: don’t wait until there is layers of heavy snow built up.
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to assemble and use. One of the spring clips went missing mid project. No extra pieces included so I had to put a bolt through it.
customer_reviews.author: Mikk-

customer_reviews.title: The best snow rake on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Our snow rakes get near-constant use at our two New Hampshire homes. We've owned and used four brands. Leave it to the Canadians to produce the best snow rakes and shovels. Garant products are the best and most durable by far. We have two of these rakes in use now--one at least seven or eight years old and one we just bought. Parts are completely interchangeable--we find that we can effectively use our rakes with up to four five-foot pole sections.
customer_reviews.author: AFJAG

customer_reviews.title: It’s a rake, for your roof
customer_reviews.text: Easy build, I had it together in a few minutes. I was outside saving my house in no time. The sections attach and detach easily enough and have a grippy quality that is quite important when trying different angles. All in all a relatively durable snow rake.
customer_reviews.author: caleb charles

customer_reviews.title: Roof snow rake
customer_reviews.text: Great roof rake, easy to put together and take apart for storing. Good quality and works well. Removes snow from roof so no ice dams form.
customer_reviews.author: John Paps

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it on two snowfalls, the first of which was about 4" of wet, heavy snow. I was able to rake off all of what needed to be removed easily. It's very lightweight and I like the way the handle sections snap together. I have already recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Myron R.

customer_reviews.title: Never Thought I Would Be Raking Snow - Leaves Yes - Snow No
customer_reviews.text: We had so much snow and roof/wall related damage this year that roof rakes were at a premium. Couldn't get one any where and when the few hardware stores that had them received a shipment there were lines an hour or more long to get one. The roof rakes that were available had aluminum blades and the nuts and bolts loosened easily and were lost and had to be replaced. I didn't know what to expect when I ordered one with a plastic blade. What a pleasant surprise. Sturdier than the aluminum rake and more rigid. I would recommend this product to everyone. One last comment: Buy it now! Get ready for next winter!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Risk free snow removal! No more ladders.
customer_reviews.text: We live at 8600 feet and this took is great for clearing light or heavy snow. Takes away the risk of falling off a ladder. Takes less then 15 to clear 280 feet of roof line that use to take hours, and no snow gets on you.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian & Linda

customer_reviews.title: Standard snow removal tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product for pulling snow off the roof, didn't get a chance yet to use it but looks good
customer_reviews.author: Benny B

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Not built very well after 1 use the support that connects the scraper to the handle broke
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this item and would buy it again! It was easy to put together, light and easy to use, and the grip on the handle is awesome! Definitely a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth S.

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool for our winters!
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine and had friends wanting to borrow! I gave one to a neighbor to share too.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Garrant GPRR24U
customer_reviews.text: One of the more economical roof rakes out there. True to it's breed: To be light enough to use at distance it flexes some. Still does the job and compared to the price of others I'd probably buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: dick

customer_reviews.title: Angled rake head
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few different rakes and this by far has been the best. The slightly angled rake head makes snow removal much easier. It's lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: RLB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value.
customer_reviews.text: Very each to assemble. Not flimsy. Easy to use. The brace gave more support. Received it today and was able to use it today.
customer_reviews.author: B. Powell

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT, WELL WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: GREAT SNOW RAKE. I HAVE A METAL ROOF, AND IT'S JUST WHAT THE DR. ORDERED. READ THE REVIEW ABOUT FLIMSY AND LITTLE TO NO DIRSECTIONS. COME ON GUYS, IT'S AN ALUMINUM POLE......PERHAPS YOU'D LIKE TO HOIST A STEEL POLE THAT LONG? ALSO, YOU DON'T EVEN NEED DIRECTIONS. LOOK AT IT, PUT YOUR COMMON SENSE HAT ON, AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES, IT'S ASSEMBLED. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE, WITH A METL ROOF.
customer_reviews.author: TOM

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Really a nice unit - easy to assemble ( 5 min) and reaches very high up on the roof —- Helps alleviate future ice dams on roof and gives you some peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally got today. Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Glad that all the stuff got there. Son really happy.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine J. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: works good!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little flimsy in the handle BUT I just tried it on the garage roof! Yep...it's gonna' work good! :-)
customer_reviews.author: sandy101

customer_reviews.title: The One to Get
customer_reviews.text: After comparing the Garant roof rake to others that appeared more sophisticated (some with cutting wires, some that "shaved" the snow, etc.), I decided to go with this one. Since receiving it, I've removed both deep, dry snow and heavy, wet snow with great success. The Garant is light weight but sturdy and the scoop of the rake seems just the right size and set at a perfect angle. It may be that some of the other much more expensive devices might be better for very set-up, crusty snow, but for typical use here in Idaho, I'm more than content with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Cain

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Terribly machined Nolte & nuts
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it 2 stars only because i think the concept is good. I’ve been working for 30 minutes to get ONE bolt to go into the provided nut. None of the bolts and nuts thread together easy. My fingers are raw. I’m hoping by the time this installation is done, the snow isn’t melted. I wanna try this thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Matty J

customer_reviews.title: Ok but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This roof snow rake is ok could be built more heavy duty the powder coated paint comes off the extension handles easy but all in all it will get the job done will see how it Holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: It worked as expected. Pay close attention when you put it together. I had to pull the metal pieces that fit inside the poles out with needle nose pliers (it wasn’t easy) because I installed it too quickly without paying attention. Expect you might get the scraper part installed backward the first time as well.
customer_reviews.author: Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Impressed at how well it worked
customer_reviews.text: I had never used this type of tool. In the beginning, it was awkward to use working over my head. After a few times, I got the hang of it and this snow blade worked great.
customer_reviews.author: thibs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Light weight easy to use. Moves loose snow easily, saves a lot of work...
customer_reviews.author: Willard

customer_reviews.title: Priced right and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Overall, good product. Lightweight and easy to maneuver even with all extensions attached. Works just as expected. I cant imagine that other roof rakes for double the cost would do that much more to warrant a higher price. I would reccomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S+M

customer_reviews.title: Great Roof Rake
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular roof rake on the basis of the positive reviews on Amazon. I'm glad I did. Some reviewers mentioned that the rake is very flexible with all of the poles assembled, and it is. And yes, this does make the rake a little more difficult to handle, but I don't think that that's a show stopper. It's a good tool and does the job well. The construction is sturdy, and I like the feeling that the poly blade won't damage the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only snow rake you need
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have had a few snow rakes and did not like them. This is the best one that I have used in 30 years. I have purchased many products that are Garant brand and they have all been the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts. Unable to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in a previously opened box, with no hardware or braces to attach the rake to the handle - even the angled pipe for the head attachment was missing. The rake is completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Regis

customer_reviews.title: Get this roof rake!  Well worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a few roof rakes that were not braced like this one, and I am so glad I picked this rake. It took a weeks worth of crusted snow off my roof. There is not a roof rake to be found within a 100 miles of CT, and Amazon came through. I put this unit through the ringer, and it did an outstanding job!!!
customer_reviews.author: MattR

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one I love this product. It’s come in handy numerous times. The only reason this is my second is because my first one is at my house in Alaska. They are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and isn't too heavy. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and isn't too heavy. It is really difficult to assemble though, I had to have my boyfriend do it because I couldn't get the tabs down in order to lock the poles together.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: First of all I had no idea what a Snow ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all I had no idea what a Snow Rake was (I'm from California) but I have to admit I did get lucky and found this on Amazon and bought it for my mother that was complaining at the time, she lives in northern Washington. Big thank you Amazon because she was most grateful for it and still uses it year after year. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Reis

customer_reviews.title: The alternative to a $200 bill to pay someone to clear my roof
customer_reviews.text: The only bad thing I can say is figuring out where to store it without breaking it down. Very happy I made this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sharon V. Seidl

customer_reviews.title: beats standing on a metal roof
customer_reviews.text: wks well while standing on a ladder if u have a metal roof with a slight angle ,only real problem is the handle, to smooth with gloves and after awhile hands get tired hard to hold,maybe add some blk non slip tape or spray only a thought,that is what i did wks good and it beats standing on a metal roof with a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: mrpaul

customer_reviews.title: Snow on the roof in Minnesota
customer_reviews.text: this was really easy to use. At first it was awkward, but once I got used to it it worked great. I have a two story house and I’m 5 ft 2 inches and 62 years old. It’s great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if it came with a rubber grip for the end of the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Christensen

customer_reviews.title: It worked all last winter, though edge is worn ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked all last winter, though edge is worn a bit. I hope to get several years out of it before replacing the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last on in 2012, works great and takes lots of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: RHB

customer_reviews.title: Pole is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The pole is flimsy and flexes instead pulling snow. Doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Romey

customer_reviews.title: NO HARDWARE
customer_reviews.text: No hardware in the box to put the rake together.
customer_reviews.author: Shanie

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with garant quality. This is my ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with garant quality. This is my second one. Replaced my old one I had for over ten years
customer_reviews.author: Daniel bosse

customer_reviews.title: Good rake
customer_reviews.text: Really needed this for the past winter and it worked great. I was careful with it but also used it hard and it survived fine
customer_reviews.author: DRKeo

customer_reviews.title: Snow rake
customer_reviews.text: This product is relatively easy to assemble. It works well but the poles are a bit too flexible. This makes it harder to handle and more labor intensive than it would be with more rigid poles. In all fairnees it is safer than getting on a snowy roof to remove the snow and it is far cheaper than paying someone else to do it.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Garant GPRR24U Yukon Snow Rake for Roofs
customer_reviews.text: Works so far this winter. It does hang up on the screws that hold down the metal roofing..So you have to lift it off of those,other wise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Get off the roof buy this
customer_reviews.text: Just what the wife wanted me to buy, no more going up on the roof works fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Brownie taurinski

customer_reviews.title: Very nice roof rake
customer_reviews.text: Very nice roof rake. I wish the handles were smooth aluminum, though. I understand that some may like the grip from the textured surface, but I cringe when it grinds across my eve trough or on the edge of my metal roof.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Peck

customer_reviews.title: Design is accurate assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.text: Rake works great I use it to remove snow from the roof. The only disappointment was it didn’t have an end Cap For the last pole which is really needed it is a sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: I can' t give a good valuation because I hardly used it
customer_reviews.text: I can' t give a good valuation because I hardly used it.But seems to be as advertised.I do not know how well the plastic rake part will last.I did use it on some somewhat harden snow it it held up.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Tavano

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my really old one. Love the textured pole. Really helps when your gloves get snowy.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: This'll do just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Always wish these could be a little more durable, but then they'd be heavy. The textured pole is nice, but plan on wearing somensortnof work glove.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Henry

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, snow removal from my rooftop will be an easy task, very handy tool .
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: NO HARDWARE!
customer_reviews.text: The rake came with no hardware nor instructions to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Kovash

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2011 here in New England and still no problems with poles or rake head.
customer_reviews.author: think it ain't

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This a practical product that every home owner who lives in a snow zone should have.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica L. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: If your a women this set is enough
customer_reviews.text: No need to buy the extra pole like did I could only lift 2 poles with rake. Keep in mind I'm a 46 yr.old Grandmother who weighs 130 lbs. & stands 5.5 but It would make a great Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Christine A. Gilliar

customer_reviews.title: This rake has saved our roofs many times over
customer_reviews.text: We have an older house with metal roofing, a greenhouse with UV-coated fiberglass, and one of those tarped carports that we use to store firewood. The roof rake with one or two extensions allows us to remove accumulated snow easily so nothing collapses under the weight. Before we bought this in 2009, we struggled with inadequate methods to keep the roofs intact. What a difference it has made, and has paid for itself many times since there are no more repair bills!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Before you open your pool .
customer_reviews.text: I have a swimming pool business and this is the best thing ever for cleaning off debris from pool covers. I use it when I open swimming pools. This is the best thing to get water and debris off the cover before you take the cover off the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Molesan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Holds up well so far with thick/heavy snow.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Recently purchased
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, easy to assemble, light weight.... shipment arrived within 2 days using Amazon Prime .
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Tagget

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this purchase. it is light, has plenty of reach, and the rake is plastic so it won't damage your roof shingles. I've used it on two blizzards since I've gotten it, and I'm definitely glad I bought it. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: PRM

customer_reviews.title: Great Roof Rake
customer_reviews.text: If you need a roof rake and everybody does........this is the one to get !! Light, easy to assemble, nice new easy grip finish on handles, long lasting and takes punishment winter after winter. The poly head will not damage the roof. Check nuts and bolts for tightness every once in a while. Will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Roof Rake
customer_reviews.text: This roof rake worked very well for our single-story home. It went together easily and seems sturdy. It was a much better alternative than getting on the ladder to clear the snow from the gutters! Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Saved by the snow rake
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on clearing the snow off the garage and house---thanks for the timely delivery!!
customer_reviews.author: kayleen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Snow Rake
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. The aluminum poles are sort of flimsy the longer you make it which knocks off 1 star. I paired it with the GPrr24e extension pole that is sold on amazon and it was difficult to figure out of they would be compatible.
customer_reviews.author: A. W

customer_reviews.title: Snow Rake and Extensions
customer_reviews.text: The snow rake and the extensions that I bought work great. I only wish I had purchased them earlier in the season. The assembly instructions were very clear. I would higly recommend this product to anyone that lives in an area that receives any measurable snow amounts. GREAT PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Keller

customer_reviews.title: too soon to tell
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't snowed yet so I don't really know. seems ok
customer_reviews.author: C. Hafemann

customer_reviews.title: Way over priced
customer_reviews.text: It is an okay product. It does the job, but it is way way overpriced. I'm sorry, it is just hard plastic and a few poles...
customer_reviews.author: Cantankerousoldie

customer_reviews.title: Rook Snow Rake
customer_reviews.text: What a good idea. When snow builds up, take a few inches at a time off with this tool. It works. Lighter than I expected which makes it relatively easy to control. My neighbors all want to borrow it now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vastrick

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, poles have an anti slip coating to make gripping easier
customer_reviews.author: donald pieschke

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!
customer_reviews.text: My old rake just died. This one looks promising. It is still a virgin as of yet. I like the handle which has a coating which makes it easier to grip.
customer_reviews.author: Canon John 3

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight but sturdy. It is perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this to clear snow off of my roof and solar panels. Very light weight but sturdy. It is perfect for my needs. Simple to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Cooper

customer_reviews.title: best for the roof
customer_reviews.text: worth it -get at least one ---key for removing snow--lightweight and safe
customer_reviews.author: steve L

customer_reviews.title: Roof Rake? House Saver!
customer_reviews.text: We had so much trouble trying to find a roof rake. It was like trying to find a 'tickle me elmo' way back when. Everytime I went to the local home improvement center, they said they had just sold out, it was on back order or "they're waitnig for the truck". What a blessing to find it online. It was worth the extra bucks to expedite the shipping. At once I had, it was a great relief to have that weight off my roof.
customer_reviews.author: Deb WH

customer_reviews.title: Got it quicker & worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We got it earlier than predicted...just in time to clean two ft of snow off roof before rain. Love it!! Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Karyl Stoia

product_meta.title: Garant GPRR24 Yukon 24-Inch Poly Blade Snow Roof Rake
product_meta.description: Remove snow from roofs, awnings and skylights with the Garant roof rake. This tool has a light and resistant polyethylene blade that does not damage roofs. Its anti-slip, ultra-light aluminum handle is designed to provide you with optimal comfort.
feature_bullets: Polyethylene blade wont damage roof top
Wide angled head for easy snow removal

specifications.Domestic Shipping: This item is available for shipping in the U.S. except for California and to select countries outside the U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars371 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
